events.name: Code Pairadise - Ruby
events.description:
A handful of us are itching to code and feeling too lonely to do it alone. So, we are spontaneously gathering this weekend for a pair-programming study group. 

*It’s simple, partner up, share your screens and code together* 
Open to both ladies and gentlemen. There will be mentors floating around so we can bug them if we can’t find solutions from each other or on stack overflow.

Do join if you have basic knowledge of RoR and have an app you would like to improve, start or work on.

Date: 29 May (this Sunday!)
Lunch: 11:30-1pm @ Bugis (optional)
Coding: 1-4pm @ Tinkerbox

events.name: Sunday Showcase: In Search of Vanishing Voices
events.description:
In Search of Vanishing Voices
Sunday, 29 May
1pm - 7pm (last entry at 6pm)
Level 4
Free admission. Register in the Lobby.

By the next century, nearly half of the estimated 7,000 languages now spoken in the world could disappear. Nanyang Technological University goes in search of fading languages, uncovering the linguistic and cultural diversity of the Southeast Asian region through inter-disciplinary collaborations amongst linguists, art and media researchers, and indigenous communities.In this month's Sunday Showcase you can wander through interactive displays, storytelling and workshops, and gain insights into rapidly disappearing native tongues that still have much to say.
